name: thekn
summary: Senior QA Engineer with extensive experience in test automation, test reliability engineering, and scaling QA practices to support high-velocity teams. Focused on operational excellence, maintainable test infrastructure, and measurable quality improvements.

experience.title: Senior QA Engineer
bullets: Led QA for a cross-functional SaaS product with thousands of daily active users and quarterly feature releases.
Architected and implemented a modular test automation framework (Playwright + REST + contract tests), integrated into CI, increasing automation coverage by 60%.
Reduced test suite flakiness by 45% using deterministic test design, environment isolation, reliable test data patterns, and tagging strategies for parallel execution.
Designed and implemented performance and load testing processes for key user workflows; provided actionable findings that improved response times by 18%.
Mentored a team of QA engineers and led initiatives to adopt quality metrics and shift-left testing practices.

experience.title: QA Engineer
bullets: Built and maintained automated test suites for web and API layers, reducing manual test time by 30% and improving release confidence.
Introduced behavior-driven testing practices (BDD) to improve communication between product, dev, and QA teams, accelerating feature delivery.
Partnered with SRE and product teams to define SLOs and surfaced drift via synthetic monitoring and end-to-end tests.
Improved test coverage by migrating legacy manual tests into automated suites and documenting test rationale for future maintenance.

skills: CI/CD Pipelines & Test Orchestration (GitHub Actions, Jenkins)
projects: Open-source Test Harness: a CLI and UI for orchestrating multiple suites and aggregating results, allowing targeted reruns and flaky-test diagnosis.
Test Data Generator: a toolkit to produce deterministic, realistic datasets for automated tests to remove data-related flakiness.
CI/CD Orchestration Scripts: developed maintainable scripts to parallelize suites and reduce total test-run time by 40%.
